Package Server.Models

Class ScheduleModel

java.lang.Object
Server.Models.ScheduleModel
public class ScheduleModel
extends java.lang.Object
Allows access to scheduling data.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs the Schedule object

  • Constructor Details

    • ScheduleModel

      public ScheduleModel​(Database dbConnection)
      Constructs the Schedule object
      Parameters:
      dbConnection - allows access to the database via the connection established at server start

  • Method Details

    • getBillboardSchedule

      public org.w3c.dom.Document getBillboardSchedule​(int billboardID)
      Gets the schedule for a billboard.
      Parameters:
      billboardID - the billboard to retrieve the schedule for
      Returns:
      a Document xml object containing the schedule details. The schedule details are enclosed in a data root element. There may be more than one schedule item in the Document (ie the billboard shows at 900 and 1500 daily for 30 minutes.

    • getSchedule

      public org.w3c.dom.Document getSchedule()
      Gets the schedule data for every billboard in the system.
      Returns:
      a Document xml object containing the schedules inside a root data element

    • removeSchedule

      public void removeSchedule​(int billboardID, int startTime)
      Removes a schedule for a specific billboard
      Parameters:
      billboardID - the billboard to remove the schedule for
      startTime - the start time of the schedule to be removed

    • setSchedule

      public boolean setSchedule​(int billboardID, int startTime, int endTime, int duration, int recurs, int weekday)
      Sets a schedule for the specified billboard
      Parameters:
      billboardID - the billboard to schedule
      startTime - the start time in 24 hour format (1500 or 900 for 3pm and 9 am respectively)
      duration - the duration to show it in minutes
      recurs - the number of minutes to wait before reshowing the billboard. Set to 0 to display once, 60 for every hour, and 1440 for every day.
      weekday - the weekday to show it on, 1 = sunday, ..., 7 = saturday
      Returns:
      an int containing the number of rows affected by the operation

    • getCurrentBillboard

      public int getCurrentBillboard​(int day, java.lang.String startTime)
